message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical exam suggest peripheral neuropathy, which is a common complication of diabetes. Gabapentin is used for the management of neuropathic pain. The other options are not indicated for this condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting symptoms of peripheral neuropathy, which may be caused by her diabetes or recent illness. Gabapentin is a medication commonly used for the treatment of neuropathic pain. The other options, Amitriptyline and Venlafaxine, are also used for neuropathic pain but are not as effective as Gabapentin. Intravenous immunoglobulin is used for immune system disorders, which are not indicated in this scenario.

Other options may also be considered, such as tricyclic antidepressants or duloxetine, depending on the patient’s individual factors and response to treatment.
